newsitem.title: UK: UK to get second weekly Lottery draw -- newspaper.
newsitem.headline: UK to get second weekly Lottery draw -- newspaper.

text.p: Britain's National Lottery regulator will on Wednesday approve plans for a second weekly draw, the Daily Telegraph reported.
The draw, likely to take place on Wednesdays, is expected to be launched early next year by lottery operator Camelot Group Plc.
National Heritage Secretary Virginia Bottomley has already given her approval for the second draw.
The National Lottery draw is televised live on Saturday night and watching it has become a ritual for millions of Britons since it was launched in November 1994.
But it has proved less popular with bookmakers and soccer pools companies who say it has taken a large bite out of their profits.
